name: Boston Brown Bread
description: A dense, slightly sweet steamed bread made with rye, whole wheat, and cornmeal.

ingredients.item: 198 grams lightly packed dark brown sugar
½ cup egg whites (from 4 to 5 large eggs)

instructions: Mise en Place:
Oven and Vessel
Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Generously coat the insides of 2 10-ounce coffee cans or a 9-by-5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.
Cut a piece of foil large enough to cover the cooking tray(s) and spray or coat with oil.
Batter
Use a scale to measure 142g cornmeal, 140g wheat flour, 140g rye flour, 3g baking powder, 11g baking soda, 3g salt in a large mixing bowl.
Mix to Combine 1 Tablespoon (16g) doenjang and 2 cups of buttermilk in a large mixing bowl.
Add 198g brown sugar to the buttermilk mixing bowl
Measure ¾ cup molasses and put into the buttermilk mixing bowl.
Measure 1 Tablespoon of measured molasses. Add to the stand mixer bowl.
Separate enough egg whites to measure ½ cups of egg whites. Add to the stand mixer bowl.
With an electric stand mixer, whip the egg whites and the 1 Tablespoon of molasses: starting slow and gradually increasing the speed to high; until stiff, silky peaks form, about 5 minutes.
While the eggs are mixing, Whisk large mixing bowl dry ingredients to combine.
Whisk the remaining molasses into the buttermilk mixture.
Gradually stir the buttermilk wet mixture into the dry ingredients until combined.
Fold in the whipped egg whites in 2 additions.
Pour batter into the prepared cans or loaf pan.
Cover the tops of the cans or pan securely with prepared oil sprayed foil
Set the cans or pan in a baking dish and add enough hot water to come about 1/4 inch up the side.
Transfer to the oven and bake until the top springs back when lightly touched, about 1 hour 40 minutes for the cans, or 2 hours for the loaf pan.
Let cool for 20 minutes on a wire rack, then invert and remove the bread to a cutting board.
Let cool completely before slicing.
